intro: Carex elongata var. brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and other grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
